intro: Piptocarpha stifftioides, commonly known as the desert aster, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and gray-green, reducing water loss through transpiration. Piptocarpha stifftioides plays an important role in stabilizing desert soils and providing nectar for pollinators.
